Detailed Description

Some Bluetooth profiles support a connect operation. BtConnectRequest is the base class for these operations. It implements the basic functionality of the connect operations. Profile specific settings and functinalities are capsuled in pure virtual functions and have to be implemented by the concrete connect operations of the various profiles.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN BtConnectRequest::Execute (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Set controller parameters and call controller function.

The Execute member function is responsible for setting the appropriate stack parameters. After performing this it calls the PerformConnectControllerCall function, which is responsible for calling the apropriate stack function.

Returns:
TRUE: The setup of the stack parameters was successfull and the Bluetooth stack accepted the requested operation.
FALSE: Either the setup of the stack parameters failed or the Bluetooth stack rejected the requested operation.

Implements BtRequest.

const btapi_connect_t * BtConnectRequest::GetApiSettings (   )  const [protected]
 

Get access to stack parameters.

The parameters that were passed to the stack are stored in the member variable m_api_connect. GetApiConnect permitts reading and writing access to this parameter storage for subclasses.

Returns:
A reference to a btapi_connect_t containing the parameters that where passed to the stack, when invoking the stack function.

virtual BOOLEAN BtConnectRequest::PerformConnectControllerCall (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Perform stack function call for connect.

Because each service interacts with a different controller, the call into this paritcular controller can not be implemented in the base class, so this function is pure virtual und has to be implemented in the concrete connect requests of the various services.

Returns:
TRUE: The Bluetooth stack accepted the connect operation.
FALSE: The Bluetooth stack rejected the connect operation.
